IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO FOSTER THE OPTIMAL DELIVERY OF NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO FOSTER THE OPTIMAL DELIVERY OF NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: CONTINUING MEDICAL EDUCATION-VARIOUS COURSES, ANNUAL SYMPOSIUM AND SCIENTIFIC SESSION AND SELF ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS WHICH PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION ON NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY AND CARDIOVASCULAR CT MATTERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY-PUBLISHED BI-MONTHLY AND DISTRIBUTED TO AN AVERAGE OF 5000 MEMBERS PER ISSUE AND 600 NON-MEMBERS AND INSTITUTIONS PER ISSUE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: REGISTRY - SUPPORTS CARDIOVASCULAR IMAGING SPECIALISTS, SCIENTISTS, TECHNOLOGISTS, AND LABORATORIES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ENHANCE THE QUALITY, SAFETY, AND VALUE OF NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY IN CLINICAL CARE LOCALLY, NATIONALLY, AND GLOBALLY. THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONWIDE AND GLOBAL CARDIOVASCULAR IMAGING DATA REGISTRY PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY FOR A NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY LABORATORY TO HAVE DATA BENCHMARKED TO NATIONAL STANDARDS OF SAFETY, EFFICIENCY, AND APPROPRIATE USE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOCIETY EVALUATES UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT RECOGNITION STANDARD. IF THAT THRESHOLD IS MET, THE TAX POSITION IS THEN MEASURED AT THE LARGEST AMOUNT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT AND IS RECOGNIZED IN THE SOCIETY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2022 AND 2021, THERE ARE NO ACCRUALS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IF APPLICABLE, THE SOCIETY RECORDS INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. TAX YEARS FROM 2019 THROUGH THE CURRENT YEAR REMAIN OPEN FOR EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE TAX AUTHORITIES.

THE IANC RESEARCH AWARD OF THE INSTITUTE FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY IS DESIGNED TO HELP INDIVIDUALS INITIATE A CAREER IN NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY RESEARCH AND TO ASSIST NEW INVESTIGATORS IN PERFORMING RESEARCH THAT WILL ADVANCE THE FIELD OF NUCLEAR CARDIOLOGY. ASNC MONITORS AWARDS MADE AND FOLLOWS UP ON THE RESULTS WHICH ARE PROVIDED IN A 5-MINUTE OVERVIEW AT THE ASNC ANNUAL MEETING.
KATHLEEN FLOOD 457(B) PLAN CONTRIBUTION FOR 2021 WAS $34,952.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ORGANIZATION MEMBER CATEGORIES ARE REGULAR MEMBERS CONSISTING OF FULL PHYSICIAN MEMBERS AND AFFILIATE MEMBERS; TECHNOLOGIST MEMBERS; ASSOCIATE MEMBERS; EMERITUS MEMBERS; HONORARY MEMBERS. THE MEMBERS ARE APPROVED THROUGH A PROCESS OF SUBMITTING APPLICATIONS AND APPROVAL BY THE SOCIETY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DURING AN ANNUAL BUSINESS MEETING, OFFICERS OF THE SOCIETY ARE ELECTED BY THE MEMBERS OF THE SOCIETY AND ONLY FULL MEMBERS ARE ALLOWED TO VOTE ON MATTERS AFFECTING THE SOCIETY. NOMINATIONS OF OFFICERS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE MEMBERSHIP BY A NOMINATING COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WORKPAPERS TO SUPPORT THE FORM 990 ARE PREPARED BY THE ACCOUNTING STAFF OF THE SOCIETY. THE INFORMATION IS FORWARDED TO THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS FOR PREPARATION. ANY AREAS OF CONCERN ARE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE SOCIETY OFFICERS (EXECUTIVE COUNCIL) FOR REVIEW. THE FINAL FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY ACCOUNTING STAFF OF THE SOCIETY, AND SIGNED BY THE CEO PRIOR TO FILING. IT IS AVAILABLE, UPON REQUEST, TO ANY MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A KEY ELEMENT IN MONITORING RELEVANT CONFLICTS OF INTEREST IS A SYSTEM OF ANNUAL DISCLOSURE. THE SOCIETY REQUIRES DISCLOSURE FROM BOARD MEMBERS, EXECUTIVE COUNCIL AND COMMITTEE MEMBERS, MEETING SPEAKERS AND PLANNERS. DISCLOSURE FORMS ARE REVIEWED BY EXECUTIVE COUNCIL OR COMMITTEES, AND DECISIONS REGARDING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE MADE BY COMMITTEE OR EXECUTIVE COUNCIL. FAILURE TO FILE DISCLOSURE CAN DISQUALIFY A PERSON FROM PARTICIPATING IN AN ACTIVITY, EITHER AS A PLANNER OR A SPEAKER, OR PARTICIPATION ON A COMMITTEE OR BOARD. EDUCATION ACTIVITIES INCLUDE A SURVEY EVALUATING POSSIBLE BIAS, WHICH ARE REVIEWED AND ACTED ON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OFFICERS OF THE SOCIETY (EXECUTIVE COUNCIL) REVIEW OUTSIDE INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION INFORMATION AS A PART OF THE CONTRACT REVIEW FOR THE CEO'S COMPENSATION. INFORMATION REVIEW INCLUDES COMPENSATION FOR OTHER EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS IN COMPARABLY SIZED MEDICAL SOCIETIES. THIS INFORMATION IS OBTAINED FROM A REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 OF THOSE SOCIETIES. IN ADDITION, SALARY SURVEYS ARE REVIEWED FROM PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS THAT REPRESENT THE NON-PROFIT ASSOCIATION FIELD. ANNUALLY, THE CEO REVIEWS SALARY SURVEYS FROM OTHER PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS IN THE WASHINGTON, DC AREA TO DETERMINE IF OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES ARE FAIRLY COMPENSATED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BYLAWS AND IRS DETERMINATION DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE OF THE SOCIETY. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PROVIDED UPON REQUEST.
CONSULTING SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 522,542. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 266,953. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 6,866. TOTAL EXPENSES 796,361.
THE AUDIT OVERSIGHT PROCESS HAS REMAINED UNCHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS YEAR.
